trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure ActiveDirectory integration with SuccessFactors | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure ActiveDirectory integration with SuccessFactors | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use SuccessFactors with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use SuccessFactors with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.

trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure ActiveDirectory integration with SuccessFactors
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure ActiveDirectory integration with SuccessFactors

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.TIP]For feedback, click [here](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529792).
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.TIP]For feedback, click [here](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=529792).

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and SuccessFactors in **SP initiated single sign-on mode**.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and SuccessFactors in **SP initiated single sign-on mode**.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:

trans-unit.source: A valid Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: A valid Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: A SuccessFactors single sign-on enabled subscription in SP initiated mode
trans-unit.target: A SuccessFactors single sign-on enabled subscription in SP initiated mode

trans-unit.source: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to SuccessFactors will be able to single sign into the application at your SuccessFactors company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the [Introduction to the Access Panel](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn308586)
trans-unit.target: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to SuccessFactors will be able to single sign into the application at your SuccessFactors company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the [Introduction to the Access Panel](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn308586)

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for SuccessFactors
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for SuccessFactors

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: Scenario
trans-unit.target: Scenario

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for SuccessFactors
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for SuccessFactors

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for SuccessFactors.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for SuccessFactors.

trans-unit.source: To enable the application integration for SuccessFactors, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To enable the application integration for SuccessFactors, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click **Active Directory**.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click **Active Directory**.

trans-unit.source: Active Directory
trans-unit.target: Active Directory

trans-unit.source: From the **Directory** list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the **Directory** list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click **Applications** in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click **Applications** in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: Applications
trans-unit.target: Applications

trans-unit.source: Click **Add** at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click **Add** at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: Add application
trans-unit.target: Add application

trans-unit.source: On the **What do you want to do** dialog, click **Add an application from the gallery**.
trans-unit.target: On the **What do you want to do** dialog, click **Add an application from the gallery**.

trans-unit.source: Add an application from gallerry
trans-unit.target: Add an application from gallerry

trans-unit.source: In the **search box**, type **SuccessFactors**.
trans-unit.target: In the **search box**, type **SuccessFactors**.

trans-unit.source: Appliation Gallery
trans-unit.target: Appliation Gallery

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select **SuccessFactors**, and then click **Complete** to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select **SuccessFactors**, and then click **Complete** to add the application.

trans-unit.source: SuccessFactors
trans-unit.target: SuccessFactors

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to SuccessFactors with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to SuccessFactors with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.

trans-unit.source: To get single sign-on configured, you will have to contact your SuccessFactors support team.
trans-unit.target: To get single sign-on configured, you will have to contact your SuccessFactors support team.

trans-unit.source: To configure single sign-on, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To configure single sign-on, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the **SuccessFactors** application integration page, click **Configure single sign-on** to open the **Configure Single Sign On ** dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the **SuccessFactors** application integration page, click **Configure single sign-on** to open the **Configure Single Sign On ** dialog.

trans-unit.source: Configure Single Sign-On
trans-unit.target: Configure Single Sign-On

trans-unit.source: On the **How would you like users to sign on to SuccessFactors** page, select **Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On**, and then click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: On the **How would you like users to sign on to SuccessFactors** page, select **Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On**, and then click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: Configure Single Sign-On
trans-unit.target: Configure Single Sign-On

trans-unit.source: On the **Configure App URL** page, perform the following steps, and then click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Configure App URL** page, perform the following steps, and then click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: Configure App URL
trans-unit.target: Configure App URL

trans-unit.source: In the **SuccessFactors Sign On URL** textbox, type your URL used by your users to sign on to your SuccessFactors application (e.g.: "*https://performancemanager4.successfactors.com/sf/home?company=CompanyName&loginMethod=SSO*").
trans-unit.target: In the **SuccessFactors Sign On URL** textbox, type your URL used by your users to sign on to your SuccessFactors application (e.g.: "*https://performancemanager4.successfactors.com/sf/home?company=CompanyName&loginMethod=SSO*").

trans-unit.source: In the **SuccessFactors Reply URL** textbox, type **https://performancemanager4.successfactors.com/saml2/SAMLAssertionConsumer?company=CompanyName**.
trans-unit.target: In the **SuccessFactors Reply URL** textbox, type **https://performancemanager4.successfactors.com/saml2/SAMLAssertionConsumer?company=CompanyName**.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] This value is only a temporary placeholder.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] This value is only a temporary placeholder.

trans-unit.source: You get the actual value from your SuccessFactors support team.
trans-unit.target: You get the actual value from your SuccessFactors support team.

trans-unit.source: Later in this tutorial, you find instructions for contacting your SuccessFactors support team.
trans-unit.target: Later in this tutorial, you find instructions for contacting your SuccessFactors support team.

trans-unit.source: In the context of this conversation, you will receive your actual SuccessFactors Reply URL.
trans-unit.target: In the context of this conversation, you will receive your actual SuccessFactors Reply URL.

trans-unit.source: On the **Configure single sign-on at SuccessFactors** page, to download your certificate, click **Download certificate**, and then save the certificate file on your computer.
trans-unit.target: On the **Configure single sign-on at SuccessFactors** page, to download your certificate, click **Download certificate**, and then save the certificate file on your computer.

trans-unit.source: Configure Single Sign-On
trans-unit.target: Configure Single Sign-On

trans-unit.source: To get SAML based single sign-on configured, contact your SuccessFactors support team and provide them with the following items:
trans-unit.target: To get SAML based single sign-on configured, contact your SuccessFactors support team and provide them with the following items:

trans-unit.source: The downloaded certificate
trans-unit.target: The downloaded certificate

trans-unit.source: The Remote Login URL
trans-unit.target: The Remote Login URL

trans-unit.source: The Remote Logout URL
trans-unit.target: The Remote Logout URL

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] Please ask your SuccessFactors support team to set the NameId Format parameter to "*Unspecified*".
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] Please ask your SuccessFactors support team to set the NameId Format parameter to "*Unspecified*".

trans-unit.source: Your Successfactors support team will send you the correct **Successfactors Reply URL** you need for the **Configure App URL** dialog.
trans-unit.target: Your Successfactors support team will send you the correct **Successfactors Reply URL** you need for the **Configure App URL** dialog.

trans-unit.source: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click **Complete** to close the **Configure Single Sign On** dialog.
trans-unit.target: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click **Complete** to close the **Configure Single Sign On** dialog.

trans-unit.source: Configure Single Sign-On
trans-unit.target: Configure Single Sign-On

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into SuccessFactors, they must be provisioned into SuccessFactors.
trans-unit.target: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into SuccessFactors, they must be provisioned into SuccessFactors.

trans-unit.source: In the case of SuccessFactors, provisioning is a manual task.
trans-unit.target: In the case of SuccessFactors, provisioning is a manual task.

trans-unit.source: To get users created in SuccessFactors, you need to contact the SuccessFactors’ support team.
trans-unit.target: To get users created in SuccessFactors, you need to contact the SuccessFactors’ support team.

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.

trans-unit.source: To assign users to SuccessFactors, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To assign users to SuccessFactors, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.

trans-unit.source: On the **SuccessFactors **application integration page, click **Assign users**.
trans-unit.target: On the **SuccessFactors **application integration page, click **Assign users**.

trans-unit.source: Assign Users
trans-unit.target: Assign Users

trans-unit.source: Select your test user, click **Assign**, and then click **Yes** to confirm your assignment.
trans-unit.target: Select your test user, click **Assign**, and then click **Yes** to confirm your assignment.

trans-unit.source: Yes
trans-unit.target: Yes

trans-unit.source: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: For more details about the Access Panel, see [Introduction to the Access Panel](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn308586).
trans-unit.target: For more details about the Access Panel, see [Introduction to the Access Panel](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn308586).

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
